alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 28 at 12:04PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTRY MIX WEDNESDAY AND POTENTIAL FOR SIGNIFICANT STORM FRIDAY... A fast moving low will track across the Panhandle from NW to SE on Wednesday. This system will produce 1 to 3 inches of snow along coastal, southern areas, and northern Lynn Canal. In addition, some mixing with rain is possible or a brief period of freezing rain. A stronger system is expected to move over the entire Panhandle on Friday. This system may produce 6 to 12 inches of snow by New Years Day, then slowly move south through Sunday with additional accumulations likely. Behind this system very cold air will move in for next week with near record breaking low temperatures along with strong outflow winds. Please stay tuned to www.weather.gov, NOAA Weather radio, or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
